properties.name: Audubon NY
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpAlbany, NYSpent a year at a desk job. Not much more to say. It was a worthwhile project with good people, but not for me.

properties.name: College Fraternity
properties.description: Posted by Jjhalp24 School St., Gorham, MEYup, you guessed it. 4 years of Natural Light and basement parties. Don\'t forget the cupula!

properties.name: Crater Lake National  Park
properties.description: Posted by Jjhalp crater lake, orI worked here for 3 seasons following Peace Corps. Had a great mentor and was able to focus on some good career and life goals. As well as celebrate Halloween in August. Just awesome.

properties.name: Fire in the desert
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpYuma, AZ4 months in Yuma was just about right. Great escape from New York, there\'s some good mtn biking just outside town and the food is excellent. Just can\'t count on too much shade, though. Make sure to check out the satellite image on this one. The green is lettuce. Unreal!

properties.name: Mazumbai
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpTanzaniaSpent most of 8 months at a university research station in the West Usambara Mountains with my good buddy, Mrecha, the forest manager. Beautiful forests and an amazing facility, amid deforestation and eroded slopes. Inspiring and depressing, but always amazing.

properties.name: Mt Bachelor U.
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpBend, OR2 winters in Bend going to COCC, and, yes, skiing at every possible chance. Good education can come with sweet powder.

properties.name: NCCC
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpAberdeen, MDThats National Civilian Community Corps, aka one wacked year. Made some great, lifelong friends despite eating in the mess hall on the base and wearing plastic boots. If it weren\'t for the Blue Rose, it would\'ve been impossible!

properties.name: Old home
properties.description: Posted by Jjhalp 140 Old Belgrade Rd., Augusta, METhis is where I grew up. It was in a rural neighborhood with lots of woods in the backyard. Now the woods are shopping malls. Development, I guess. The photo is from the 1998 ice storm.

properties.name: Peace Corps
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpTogo2 years in northern Togo is way better than getting teeth pulled, except during the hot season. Fufu, tchouk, and barbeque dog. Good stuff! Finally went back to visit in 2004 after being gone for 7 years. Will have to go again.

properties.name: Planet Chugach
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpMoose Pass, AKThere are more stories from Moose Pass than can be told here. Just don\'t forget the horse in the hole.

properties.name: Reid State Park
properties.description: Posted by Jjhalp Georgetown, METhe site of my 1st outdoor job. Thanks Norm!

properties.name: Wolfpack years
properties.description: Posted by JjhalpRaleigh, NCGrad school for forestry at NCSU. Good friends and a free 8 month trip to Tanzania. Sweet!
